channel.title: Learn :: DevDocs Navigation Menu Test
channel.description: Learn about Okta and Identity Access Management Click here to give feedback about this page Group Notes Group description: - The “Learn” section guides developers new to IAM and/or Okta through the basics of OAuth, IAM, and Okta’s products. The goal of this section is to empower these developers to be successful in developing applications using Okta’s products. It serves as a one-stop resource for understanding Okta’s products’ features, the necessary tools for development, and industry best practices, ensuring developers have a solid foundation to start building secure and efficient applications.

item.title: Workforce Identity Cloud (WIC)
item.description: Workforce Identity Cloud (WIC) overview Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: New IAM Developers,Developers new to Okta Description: Explains WIC and compares it to the CIC domain. Describes the domain of what developer.okta.com covers. Why is this here?: - 26% of respondents could not identify Workforce Identity Cloud despite “Workforce” being in the definition. Developers new to IAM and Okta are less satisfied with the docs and visit rarely.

item.title: Identity Access Management (IAM)
item.description: Identity Access Management (IAM) basics Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: New IAM Developers,Developers new to Okta Description: Explains at a high level what is IAM. Links to original docs: This is a new doc. Bits of this doc can come from: Identity and Access Management (IAM) overview: https://developer.okta.com/docs/concepts/iam-overview/ Why is this here?: See (ID: 1) Structure type: Concept Content type: Conceptual overview Conceptual overviews present a high-level introduction to a topic.

item.title: Application Types
item.description: What types of application can you build? Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Description: Explains at a high level the different types of applications developers can build as Okta defines them. (covering web apps (OIDC, SAML, SWA), API Service Apps, Lifecycle apps (SCIM and Workflow Connectors)) Expand “Create your own integration in Okta” to be more of a thought-leading piece about making any type of app public or private and the pros and cons of that decision.

item.title: Multifactor Authentication (MFA)
item.description: Multifactor Authentication (MFA) Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: New IAM Developers,Developers new to Okta Description: Explain the very basic concept of MFA. Also, explain the difference between a Factor and an Authenticator. Why is this here?: ‘- External Oktane 2023: 20% of respondents placed “Multi-factor Authentication” under “IAM Fundamentals”. After discussions with employees (and probably customers as well) there is a misunderstanding of what is a “Factor” and what is an Authenticator".

item.title: Single Sign-On (SSO)
item.description: Single Sign-On (SSO) at Okta Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: New IAM Developers,Developers new to Okta Description: Answers “What is SSO?”, how it differs from a basic sign in, and “How Okta supports it”. Also “How does a user experience SSO from the Okta End User Dashboard or from another place?” Note SSO is a generic industry concept, but Okta SSO is a product, compare with SLO, UL and introduce the concept of SSO integrations in OIN, but more as a link to the Learn > OIN > OIn Integrations page.

item.title: OAuth and OIDC
item.description: OAuth and OIDC Explained Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: New IAM Developers,Developers new to Okta Links to original docs: - OAuth 2.0 and OpenID Connect overview: https://developer.okta.com/docs/concepts/oauth-openid/ Structure type: Concept Content type: Conceptual overview Conceptual overviews present a high-level introduction to a topic. Such high-level overviews provide developers with a broad understanding of the system’s workings. Deeper discussions into single topics are called Explanations.

item.title: SAML
item.description: Understand SAML Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: New IAM Developers,Developers new to Okta Changes to be made: Update the flow charts away from Plant UML to use the Figma design. Links to original docs: - SAML: https://developer.okta.com/docs/concepts/saml/ Structure type: Concept Content type: Conceptual overview Conceptual overviews present a high-level introduction to a topic. Such high-level overviews provide developers with a broad understanding of the system’s workings.

item.title: Okta Basics
item.description: Understand Okta’s Products Click here to give feedback about this page Group Notes Group description: This section gives new-to-IAM or new-to-Okta developers a high-level overview of Okta’s products to help them be successful in building solutions with Okta. Content Notes Target personas: New IAM Developers,Developers new to Okta Why is this here?: See Learn (ID: 1) Structure type: Navigation Content type: Guide Hub A guide hub is the main navigation page for a section, such as learn, plan, or build.

item.title: Single Logout (SLO) and Universal Logout (UL)
item.description: Single Logout (SLO) and Universal Logout (UL) Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: New IAM Developers,Developers new to Okta Description: Summary overview of the two sign-out products from Okta, paying special attention to the scenarios in which they will apply. One of the goals is to have readers understand the difference between the two products, their limitations and where to find more info on how to implement them in their apps.

item.title: Automation Tools
item.description: Okta Automation Tools Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: New IAM Developers,Developers new to Okta Structure type: Navigation Content type: Autogenerated Index An autogenerated index is an automatically generated list of links to topics immediately beneath it based purely on the site’s structure, or with some level of filtering. A blind list of summaries and links to child docs.

item.title: User Lifecycle Management (LCM)
item.description: User Lifecycle Management (LCM) Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: New IAM Developers,Developers new to Okta Description: An overview of lifecycle management, and why we care about it, or at least why Enterprise app vendors care about it, and what that means for developers who need to incorporate it. Add emphasis on user provisioning and deprovisioning in this doc. Also mention LCM apps in the OIn catalog.

item.title: Identity Governance
item.description: Identity Governance Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: New IAM Developers,Developers new to Okta Description: (defines and outlines PAM, IGA, and the differences between them and IAM, and how you have to pay for them separately - differnet skus) Structure type: Concept Content type: Conceptual overview Conceptual overviews present a high-level introduction to a topic. Such high-level overviews provide developers with a broad understanding of the system’s workings.

item.title: Okta Integration Network (OIN)
item.description: Okta Integration Network (OIN) Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: New IAM Developers,Developers new to Okta Description: An introduction to the OIN, what it is, what an integration is, different types of integration in the OIN, differences between OIN Manager and OIN Wizard, why publish to the OIN at all? Lists reasons why people / ISVs should care about publishing on the OIN Can also include a definition of ISV
